items.message: Strong northerly winds associated with Storm Arwen are expected to cause large waves and spray overtopping along the North Yorkshire Coast from midnight Friday 26th November 2021 to Saturday 27th November 17:00. Hazardous conditions might extend 2 hours either side of the high tide. The particular areas at risk are exposed areas of the coast around the North Sea coast from Bridlington to Barmston. Please be careful along beaches, coastal footpaths and roads in the area, as large waves and sea spray can be dangerous with debris. We will continue to monitor the forecast and levels closely. This message will be updated by noon on Saturday 27th November 2021, or as the situation changes.

Flood warning issued due to strong northerly winds associated with Storm Arwen expected to cause large waves and spray overtopping along the North Yorkshire Coast tomorrow morning, Saturday 27th November between 07:30 and 14:30. Hazardous conditions might extend 2 hours either side of the high tide. Areas most at risk are properties at Sandside, where localised flooding may occur due to overtopping and spray.  Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous with debris. You can check flood warnings and alerts on the GOV.UK website or via Floodline number 0345 988 1188. We are monitoring the situation closely. This message will be updated by noon on Saturday 27th November 2021, or as the situation changes.

items.message: Strong northerly winds associated with Storm Arwen are expected to cause large waves and spray overtopping along the North Yorkshire Coast from Friday 26th November 2021 21:00 until midnight, tomorrow morning, Saturday 27th November between 07:00 and 15:00; and evening between 22:00 and 02:00 on Sunday 28th November 2021. Hazardous conditions might extend 2 hours either side of the high tide. The particular areas at risk are exposed areas of the coast around Scarborough, particularly low lying paths around Scarborough South Bay. Please be careful along beaches, coastal footpaths and roads in the area, as large waves and sea spray can be dangerous with debris. We will continue to monitor the forecast and levels closely. This message will be updated by noon on Saturday 27th November 2021, or as the situation changes.

Large and powerful waves are expected to overtop sea defences as a result of Storm Arwen.  High tides are expected at 20:30 today, 26/11/2021 and 08:30 tomorrow, 27/11/2021 however strong waves are expected throughout the night and into tomorrow morning. Areas most at risk are beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.  

This message will be updated by 10:30 tomorrow morning, 27/11/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast from Staithes to Whitby including tidal River Esk
items.message:
Strong northerly winds associated with Storm Arwen are expected to cause large waves and spray overtopping along the North Yorkshire Coast starting from Friday evening, 26th November 2021, from 20:00 until midnight, Saturday 27th November between 07:00 and 13:30, and the evening tide between 19:00 and midnight. Hazardous conditions might extend 2 hours either side of the high tide. The particular areas at risk are exposed areas of the coast around Staithes and Whitby, alongside low lying paths around Whitby Harbour. 

Please be careful along beaches, coastal footpaths and roads in the area, as large waves and sea spray can be dangerous with debris. We will continue to monitor the forecast and levels closely. This message will be updated by noon on Saturday 27th November 2021, or as the situation changes.
